litw-study-description-p1: In this study we will be trying to understand the way people have been influenced by their cultural background, and whether this affects how people process information. More specifically, this study aims to clarify whether some people are better in ignoring contextual information than others.
litw-study-description-p2: Click the button below to get started!
litw-template-title: LabintheWild: The Frame and Line study
litw-irb-header: Welcome to the LabintheWild Frame and Line study!
litw-irb-subheader-1: You're about to take a test on LabintheWild. Your contribution to our research allows us to learn more about cognitive differences around the world. The results from your test will also tell you something about yourself!
litw-irb-subheader-2: Please read the following information carefully before proceeding.
litw-irb-body-1-p1: Why we are doing this research?
litw-irb-body-1-p2: We are trying to understand the way people have been influenced by their cultural background, and whether this affects how people process information. More specifically, this study aims to clarify whether some people are better in ignoring contextual information than others. Our aim is to apply the results to different user interface designs.
litw-irb-body-2-p1: What will you have to do?
litw-irb-body-2-p2: We will be asking you to pay attention to a square box within which you will see a vertical line. Subsequently, you will be shown another square box of the same or different size and asked to reproduce the line that you have seen in the frame before. Pressing the back button or leaving the test will cause all progress to be lost. You will receive more specific instructions shortly.
litw-irb-body-3-p1: What will you get out of it?
litw-irb-body-3-p2: We will give you feedback on how your results compare to those of other participants. The final results from this experiment will be posted on our blog page. The experiment is not designed to benefit you, but you may enjoy it and enjoy comparing your results with those of other participants.
litw-irb-body-4-p2: We will not ask you for your name. Any data that we collect will be securely stored on our servers.
litw-irb-body-6-p2: If you have questions or concerns about this research, you may contact Professor Katharina Reinecke, Paul G. Allen Center for Computer Science & Engineering, Box 352350, Seattle, WA 98195, reinecke@cs.washington.edu.
litw-irb-body-final: If you have questions about your rights as a research participant, or wish to obtain information, ask questions or discuss any concerns about this study with someone other than the researcher(s), please contact the Unversity of Washington IRB.
litw-irb-consent: By ticking this box, you are agreeing to be in the study. Be sure that questions you have about the study have been answered and that you understand what you are being asked to do. You may contact the researcher if you think of a question later. You are free to leave the experiment at any time, and refusing to be in the experiment or stopping participation will involve no penalty or loss of benefits to which you are otherwise entitled.
litw-irb-warning: You must check the box to continue.
litw-demographics-title: Please tell us a little bit about yourself.
litw-demographics-required: To proceed, please properly answer all fields below. (The ones marked with * are mandatory.)
litw-demographics-title-tip: We need this information for data analysis. Please note that none of the answers are personally identifiable. We take your privacy very seriously. You may email us at info@labinthewild.org for more information.
litw-demographics-minor-alert1: Sorry, we currently do not have approval from our Institutional Review Board to conduct this study with minors younger than 14 years old.
litw-demographics-minor-alert2: In five seconds, we're redirecting you to our home page where you can participate in other studies.
litw-demographics-retake: Have you taken this test before?
litw-demographics-country-grow: Which country did you live the longest growing up?
litw-demographics-country-live: Which country do you currently live in?
litw-demographics-religion: What religion or religious denomination do you belong to?
litw-demographics-education: What is your highest level of formal education?
litw-demographics-education4: Incomplete secondary school or high school
litw-demographics-education5: Complete secondary school or high school
litw-demographics-country: What country are you from? (If you have lived in several countries, please indicate the country you have lived in longest.)
litw-demographics-culture: Which country is most representative of your cultural background?
litw-demographics-culture-tip: For most people, this will be the country they were born in and probably still live in.
litw-demographics-race-islander: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander
litw-comment-subtitle: Before you continue to your results, please let us know what you thought of the study!
litw-comment-q1: Do you have any comments for the researcher? Questions, Suggestions, or Concerns?
litw-comment-q21: Did you encounter any technical difficulties during this study?
litw-comment-q31: Did you cheat or in any way provide false information?
litw-comment-email-p1: You can also email us at
litw-instruct-header-2_1: In this study, you will work on the Framed-Line Test.
litw-instruct-header-2_2: Before telling you how well you did in the line-drawing task, we want you to try another version of the same task.
litw-instruct-header-3_1-absolute: Please, read all the slides below to make sure you fully understand the task.
litw-instruct-header-3_1-relative: Please, read all the slides below to make sure you fully understand the task.
litw-instruct-header-3_2-absolute: In the first version of the line-drawing task, you drew lines that were the same RELATIVE length as the first line. Now, in this second version, we want you to draw a line that is the same ABSOLUTE length as the first line.
litw-instruct-header-3_2-relative: In the first version of the line-drawing task, you drew lines that were the same ABSOLUTE length as the first line. Now, in this second version, we want you to draw a line that is the same RELATIVE length as the first line.
litw-instruct-intro1-relative: In this test, you first look at a square with a line inside of it. After a couple of seconds, you will see a square that is bigger, smaller, or the same size as the first square. In this second square, please draw a line that has the same RELATIVE length as the first line.
litw-instruct-intro1-absolute: In this test, you first look at a square with a line inside of it. After a couple of seconds, you will see a square that is bigger, smaller, or the same size as the first square. In this second square, please draw a line that has the same ABSOLUTE length as the first line.
litw-instruct-intro2-relative: In the relative version of the test, you will look again at a square with a line inside of it. After 5 seconds, you will see a square that is bigger, smaller, or the same size as the first square. So far, this is exactly what you did in the absolute portion.
litw-instruct-intro2-absolute: In the absolute version of the test, you will look again at a square with a line inside of it. After 5 seconds, you will see a square that is bigger, smaller, or the same size as the first square. So far, this is exactly what you did in the relative portion.
litw-instruct-examples1-relative: In other words, the new line has to keep the same PROPORTIONAL size inside the new frame as the original line and frame. In the examples below, the middle one is correct because it keeps the original RELATIVE size of the line and the frame. The line on the left has a larger proportion than the original while the right one a smaller proportion.
litw-instruct-examples1-absolute: In other words, the new line has to have the SAME LENGTH as the original line. In the examples below, the middle one is correct because the lines have the same length REGARDLESS the the size of the frame. The line on the left is shorter than the original while the one on the right is larger.
litw-instruct-examples2-absolute: Now, here is the main departure from the previous task: You have to draw a line that has the SAME LENGTH as the original line. In the examples below, the middle one is correct because the lines have the same length REGARDLESS the the size of the frame. The line on the left is sorter than the original while the one on the right is larger.
litw-instruct-examples2-relative: Now, here is the main departure from the previous task: You have to draw a line that has the same PROPORTIONAL size inside the new frame as the original line and frame. In the examples below, the middle one is correct because it keeps the original RELATIVE size of the line and the frame. The line on the left has a larger proportion than the original, while the right one a smaller proportion.
litw-instruct-rule_1: Please do not use your finger or any device to measure the lengths of the lines. Otherwise the exercise becomes pointless.
litw-instruct-rule_2: One again, it is very important that you do not use your finger or any device to measure the lengths of the lines.
litw-instruct-keys_1: In drawing lines, hold down the DOWN-ARROW key on your keyboard or click the down button to draw the line. Hold down the UP-ARROW or click the up button for adjustments. When you are done, click the CHECK-MARK to submit your answer.
litw-instruct-keys_2: As before, hold down the DOWN-ARROW key on your keyboard or click the down button to draw the line. Hold down the UP-ARROW or click the up button for adjustments. When you are done, click the CHECK-MARK to submit your answer.
litw-practice-p1: Let's work on a few practice trials. When you are ready, please press the button below.
litw-practice-p2-relative: Look at this and prepare yourself to draw a line that has the same RELATIVE length.
litw-practice-p2-absolute: Look at this and prepare yourself to draw a line that has the same ABSOLUTE length.
litw-practice-p3-relative: Now, use the DOWN-ARROW to draw a line that has the same RELATIVE length in the new square.
litw-practice-p3-absolute: Now, use the DOWN-ARROW to draw a line that has the same ABSOLUTE length in the new square.
litw-practice-p4: You may also use the UP-ARROW key for adjustments.
litw-practice-p5: When you are done, click the DONE BUTTON to continue.
litw-practice-p6: On the left is the original line, on the right is the line you drew.
litw-practice-p7-relative: Remember, please draw a line that has the same RELATIVE length to the square size as the first.
litw-practice-p7-absolute: Remember, please draw a line that has the same ABSOLUTE length to the square size as the first.
litw-practice-p8: Are you ready for another practice trial? If so, please press XX to start.
litw-practice-result-p2: You can try it again by clicking the REDO BUTTON on the left.
litw-practice-result-p3: Or you can finish practice by clicking the DONE BUTTON on the right.
litw-study-p1-original: Now, you will perform 5 trials in a row. Please perform the task as accurately as possible. You will have 5 seconds to do so. We will tell you how well you performed at the end of this session.
litw-study-p1: Now, you will perform 5 trials in a row. Please perform the task as accurately as possible.
litw-study-p2: When you are ready, please press the arrow on the NEXT arrow below.
litw-results-header2-absolute: It seems you did better in the absolute tasks, which is connected to having a more analytic visual perception.
litw-results-header2-relative: It seems you did better in the relative tasks, which is connected to having a more holistic visual perception.
litw-results-details-relative: Your relative lines were off by:
litw-results-details-absolute: Meanwhile, your absolute lines were off by:
litw-results-explanation-analytic: An analytical mindset tends to focus on the foreground elements of a scene (for example, the individual fish in an aquarium).
litw-results-explanation-holistic: The holistic mindset tends to first look at the contextual elements and their relation with foreground elements (like the aquarium setup and where the fish are in relation to that.)
litw-results-citation1: You can read more about this different mindsets and global trends HERE...
litw-more-title: If you enjoyed this study, there's more!
litw-more-step1: Visit and follow us on Facebook to learn about new studies:
litw-more-step2: Share this study with your friends!
litw-more-step3: And consider participating in some of our other studies:
litw-more-study1-slogan: How well can AI understand your speech?
litw-more-study1-description: Find out how well AI can understand your speech by reading out loud a few words and sentences! The test takes around 7 minutes.
litw-more-study2-slogan: Learn to be a better writer!
litw-more-study2-description: Can you identify the writing strategies of experts? Improve your reading and writing while comparing yourself to experts in this 10 minute study!
